sen.j: 湯取は、炊干よりも大量の水で米を煮て、頃合いを見てザルにあけ、再び鍋や釜に戻して蒸らす方法である。
sen.e: Yutori is a method in which rice is boiled in a greater quantity of water than in the takiboshi method, drained into a colander at an appropriate time, returned to the pot again and steamed.

The more it is washed, the less the smell of the rice bran will permeate the rice.
The more it is washed, the less the smell of rice bran will permeate rice.

sen.j: 日本では、水が澄むまで繰り返す人が多いが、そこまで糠を嫌うなら通常は無洗米の方が経済的である。
sen.e: In Japan, many people repeat until the water is clear, but if the rice bran is that intolerable, then, in general, using no-wash rice is more economical.
In Japan, many people repeat until the water is clear, but if the rice bran is that intolerable, then, in general, using no-wash rice is more economical.
In Japan, many people repeat until the water is clear, but if rice bran is that intolerable, then, in general, using no-wash rice is more economical.

sen.j: 水加減 一般的に米の20%増しの分量といわれる。
sen.e: Amount of water, in general, one should use 20% more water than the amount of rice.
The amount of water used, in general, should be 20% more water than the amount of rice.
The amount of water used, in general, should be 20% more water than the amount of rice.

sen.j: 1合の場合水約200mL。
sen.e: For one go, 200 ml of water should be used.
For one go, 200 ml of water should be used.
For one go, 200 ml of water should be used.

sen.j: 30分ほど水に浸して水分を吸わせる。
sen.e: Soak in water for about 30 minutes to let the water get absorbed.
Soak in water for about 30 minutes to let the water get absorbed.
Soak in water for about 30 minutes to let the water get absorbed.

sen.j: 炊飯 炊飯器で炊く場合はスイッチを入れるだけで良いことが多い。
sen.e: Cooking, if cooking in a rice cooker, often times all there is to do is to turn on the switch.
CookingIf cooking in a rice cooker, often times only a switch needs to be turned on to commence cooking.
Cooking; if cooking in a rice cooker, often times only a switch needs to be turned on to commence cooking.
sen.cmt: スタイルを変えました。

sen.j: 鍋を使う場合は、最初は強火で炊き、蓋がコトコトしてきたら10分ほど弱火で炊く。
sen.e: If using a pot, then the rice should be cooked over high heat at the beginning, and when the lid starts to rattle then it should be cooked for about 10 minutes over low heat.
If using a pot, then the rice should be cooked over high heat at the beginning, and when the lid starts to rattle it should be cooked for about 10 minutes over low heat.
If using a pot, rice should be cooked over high heat at the beginning, and when the lid starts to rattle it should be cooked for about 10 minutes over low heat.

sen.j: 最後にもう一度強火にし、すぐに火を止める。
sen.e: Turn up the heat to high once more at the end and then turn off the heat immediately.
Turn up the heat to high once more at the end and then turn off the heat immediately.
Turn up the heat to high once more at the end and then turn off the heat immediately.

sen.j: むらし 炊きあがってから10～15分ほど蒸らす。
sen.e: Steaming, after the rice is cooked, let it steam for 10 to 15 minutes.
Steaming After the rice is cooked, let it steam for 10 to 15 minutes.
Steaming; After the rice is cooked, let it steam for 10 to 15 minutes.
sen.cmt: スタイルを変えました。

sen.j: 蒸らし足りないと米に芯が残るが、蒸らしすぎるとベチャベチャになってしまう。
sen.e: If steaming is inadequate then the rice will not be cooked through, but if steamed too much then the rice will be too pasty.
If steaming is inadequate then the rice will not be cooked through, but if steamed too much then the rice will be too pasty.
If steaming is inadequate then the rice will not be cooked through, but if steamed too much then the rice will be too pasty.

sen.j: 蒸らし終わったら良くかき混ぜる。
sen.e: Once the steaming is done, then mix well.
Once steamed, then mix well.
Once steamed, then mix well.

sen.j: 保存 炊飯ジャーの場合はそのままで保温されるが、高温なので劣化し臭くなる。
sen.e: Storage, if using a rice cooker then the rice will be kept warm, but because of the high temperature the rice will deteriorate and it will start to smell.
StorageIf using a rice cooker then the rice will be kept warm, but because of the high temperature the rice will deteriorate and it will start to smell.
Storage; if using a rice cooker then rice will be kept warm, but because of the high temperature rice will deteriorate and it will start to smell.
sen.cmt: スタイルを変えました。

sen.j: 密閉して、1日後に食べるなら冷蔵庫に、2日以上後に食べるなら冷凍庫に入れて保存する方法もある。
sen.e: There is a storage method of sealing the rice airtight and keeping it in the refrigerator if it will be eaten within one day, or in the freezer if it won't be consumed within two days.
There is a storage method of sealing the rice airtight and keeping it in the refrigerator if it will be eaten within one day, or in the freezer if it won't be consumed within two days.
There is a storage method of sealing rice airtight and keeping it in the refrigerator if it will be eaten within one day, or in the freezer if it won't be consumed within two days.

sen.j: 食べる時に電子レンジで加熱して温める。
sen.e: Before eating, it should be heated using a microwave oven.
Before eating, it should be heated using a microwave oven.
Before eating, it should be heated using a microwave oven.

sen.j: 味は若干落ちるが、劣化は少ない。
sen.e: The rice will be slightly less tasty, but there will be little deterioration.
The rice will be slightly less tasty, but there will be little deterioration.
The rice will be slightly less tasty, but deterioration will be little.

sen.j: 現在では、米を炊いた物を指すのが一般的である。
sen.e: Nowadays, it generally refers to rice that has been cooked.
Nowadays, it generally refers to rice that has been cooked.
Nowadays, it generally refers to rice that has been cooked.

sen.j: 米である事を明確にする場合は、「米飯」（べいはん）、「飯米」（はんまい）や「米の飯」と言う。
sen.e: To make it clear that it refers to rice, it is called 'beihan,' 'hanmai' or 'kome no meshi.'
To make it clear that it refers to rice, it is called 'beihan,' 'hanmai' or 'kome no meshi.'
To make it clear that it refers to rice, it is called 'beihan,' 'hanmai' or 'kome no meshi.'

sen.j: 白米の米飯は白く、銀しゃりとも呼ばれる。
sen.e: The beihan made of white rice is white, and it is also called ginshari (silver rice).
Beihan made of white rice is white, and it is also called ginshari (silver rice).
Beihan made of white rice is white, and it is also called ginshari (silver rice).

sen.j: 国内で最も食べられている主食だが、割合は減少している。
sen.e: Domestically, it is the main staple that is consumed the most, but its consumption ratio is diminishing.
Domestically, it is the type that is consumed the most, but the consumption ratio of this type is diminishing.
Domestically, it is the type that is consumed the most, but the consumption ratio of this type is diminishing.

sen.j: 「美味しいご飯があればおかずは要らない」等と言う人がいるが、白米では栄養的に可能でない。
sen.e: There are people who say that 'no accompanying dishes are necessary if there is good-tasting cooked rice,' but this is not nutritiously possible with white rice.
There are people who say that 'no accompanying dishes are necessary if there is good-tasting cooked rice,' but this is not nutritiously possible with white rice.
There are people who say that 'no accompanying dishes are necessary if there is good-tasting cooked rice,' but this is not nutritiously possible with white rice.

sen.j: 白米の米飯は、デンプンの割合が多い程、食感に日本人好みの粘りがある。
sen.e: In beihan made with white rice, the higher the amount of starch is the stickier the texture is, which is what the Japanese people like.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In beihan made with white rice, the higher the amount of starch is the stickier the texture is, which is what the Japanese favor.
In beihan made with white rice, the higher the amount of starch is the stickier the texture is, which is what the Japanese favor.

sen.j: 良食味米はタンパク質等のデンプン以外の成分が少ない。
sen.e: Other than starch, good-tasting rice does not have much nutritional components such as protein.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Other than starch, good-tasting rice does not have as much nutritional components such as protein.
Other than starch, good-tasting rice does not have as much nutritional components such as protein.

sen.j: もち米を用いることもあるが、通常はうるち米を用いる。
sen.e: Glutinous rice may be used, but in general, non-glutinous rice is used.
Glutinous rice may be used, but in general, non-glutinous rice is used.
Glutinous rice may be used, but in general, non-glutinous rice is used.

sen.j: ムギまたは麦と米の飯を「麦飯」と言う。
sen.e: Meshi made of mugi or mugi and rice is called 'mugi meshi.'
Meshi made of mugi or mugi and rice is called 'mugi meshi.'
Meshi made of barley (mugi) and rice is called 'mugi meshi.'
sen.cmt: 麦に説明をつけました。

sen.j: 普通はオオムギである。
sen.e: Usually barley is used.
Usually barley is used.
Usually barley is used.

sen.j: 但し、外食産業等で米に二つ割の大麦を混ぜて炊いた飯は通常麦飯と呼ばない。
sen.e: However, meshi made by mixing split barley into rice, as they are served in the restaurant industry, is generally not called mugi meshi.
sen.cmt: 二つ割の大麦 定訳不明
sen.e: However, meshi made by mixing split barley into rice, as they are served in the restaurant industry, is generally not called mugi meshi.
However, meshi made by mixing split barley into rice, as they are served in the restaurant industry, is generally not called mugi meshi.

sen.j: 何も混ぜない白飯のほかに、様々な材料を混ぜて味付けした飯もある。
sen.e: Besides white rice that has nothing mixed in it, there are meshi dishes seasoned with various ingredients.
Besides white rice that has nothing mixed in it, there are meshi dishes seasoned with various ingredients.
Besides white rice that has nothing mixed in it, there are meshi dishes seasoned with various ingredients.

sen.j: 魚介類や肉、野菜などの具と一緒に醤油などで味付けて炊き込んだ飯を「炊き込みご飯」「加薬飯（加薬ご飯）」「五目飯（五目御飯）」（具は松茸、鯛、豆等がある）と言う。
sen.e: Meshi dishes cooked together with ingredients such as seafood, meat or vegetables and seasoned with soy sauce is called 'takikomi gohan,' 'kayaku gohan' or 'gomoku meshi (gomoku gohan)' (the ingredients are matsutake mushrooms, bream, peas and so on).

Meshi dishes cooked together with ingredients such as seafood, meat or vegetables and seasoned with soy sauce is called 'takikomi gohan,' 'kayaku gohan' or 'gomoku meshi (gomoku gohan)' (the ingredients are matsutake mushrooms, bream, peas and so on).

sen.j: グリーンピースを加えて味付けに塩を入れて炊いた豆ご飯もある。
sen.e: Mame gohan is rice cooked with green peas and seasoned with salt.
Mame gohan is rice cooked with green peas and seasoned with salt.
Mame gohan is rice cooked with green peas and seasoned with salt.

sen.j: もち米に米以外の材料を混ぜて炊いたご飯を、「おこわ（こわめし）」「おこわ」と呼ぶが、これらの語は色付けにアズキをいれた赤飯を指す場合が多い。
sen.e: A rice dish cooked with glutinous rice mixed with ingredients other than rice is called 'okowa (kowameshi)' or 'okowa,' but these words often refer to sekihan that uses azuki beans that adds color.
A rice dish cooked with glutinous rice mixed with ingredients other than rice is called 'okowa (kowameshi)' or 'okowa,' but these words often refer to sekihan that uses azuki beans that adds color.

A rice dish cooked with glutinous rice mixed with ingredients other than rice is called 'okowa' or 'kowameshi,' but these words often refer to sekihan (red rice) that uses azuki beans to add color (red).

sen.j: 最近では、健康志向で発芽玄米や雑穀入りご飯の他、Ca等ミネラルの添加剤も混ぜられる。
sen.e: Recently, because of the health-oriented trend, mineral additives such as calcium are mixed into the rice, besides rice dishes made with sprouted brown rice or various other cereal grains.
